column5: I was competing in my schools Basketball three point shot competition. The rules were that the person with the most shots in out of three would win or move on to the next round if there was a tie in the first.  In the first round I tied with 3 other people we hit 2 out of three which was the most  so we moved on to the next round in the next round the others had 1 out of three while I had 2 out of three so I won.  I know that this had nothing to do with Fishing but I was just really happy that I won.
Congrats!  It's always harder to shoot when the pressure is on.  Charles
Congratulations.  Now grow to around 6'8", take the right courses and finish in the top 25% of your class.
And if that doesn't work, use those same skills to practice with a Flipping Jig.  You'll be hitting the docks for 3 pointers in no time  Congrats on the 3 point competition.    Hookset.

Ya, 3 pnts for hitting the dock.....6 for chipping the paint on a $60,0000 bass boat.  Then a grand to touch up the chunk out of the glass after the guy catches you after the short but dramatic chase across the lake.  Congrats BTW, and you would have hit all 3 shots in the second round if you didn't try to show off!

The so called basketball coach who coaches at my school didnt pick me because Im a little over weight and another stupid reason was that he didnt want a person like my to be waiting at the three point line to get the ball to shoot.  pretty retarded EH
Congratulations.  It is good to see a young person enjoying some healthy competition.  outdoorguy61
Too bad basketball's an 84' game and not half court.  Maybe you can pick up extra cash playing horse.
